s1: This course provides students with hands-on experience of being a researcher in the computing discipline.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse software vulnerabilities, both in the source code and in program binaries, and design and implement appropriate mitigation techniques.

s1: It exposes the students to research skills, problem solving skills, team work and project management.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse software vulnerabilities, both in the source code and in program binaries, and design and implement appropriate mitigation techniques.

s1: Each student will work on a small-scale research project supervised by an academic researcher.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse software vulnerabilities, both in the source code and in program binaries, and design and implement appropriate mitigation techniques.

s1: A central part of the course will be a mock-conference to which all students will submit a paper to about their research. Students will anonymously review each others papers, respond to the reviews and submit a final version of their paper that considers reviewer comments.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse software vulnerabilities, both in the source code and in program binaries, and design and implement appropriate mitigation techniques.

s1: At the end of the course, students will give a talk about their research and present a poster.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse software vulnerabilities, both in the source code and in program binaries, and design and implement appropriate mitigation techniques.

s1: Throughout the course there will be meetings where students discuss all aspects of their projects, as well as a set of lectures about different aspects of being a successful researcher.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse software vulnerabilities, both in the source code and in program binaries, and design and implement appropriate mitigation techniques.

s1: Understand the main principles and concepts in at least two areas of computer science that are being actively shaped by research.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse software vulnerabilities, both in the source code and in program binaries, and design and implement appropriate mitigation techniques.

s1: Have an understanding of the research methods being employed in these areas.
s2: Demonstrate a thorough understanding in exploitation techniques against software vulnerabilities and defensive techniques against these exploitations.

s1: Have a basis of the knowledge and skills in research projects that can be built upon for more substantial projects.
s2: Demonstrate a thorough understanding in exploitation techniques against software vulnerabilities and defensive techniques against these exploitations.

s1: Have an understanding of how to be a successful researcher.
s2: Demonstrate proficiency in software reverse engineering.

s1: Have a finished research paper that can be submitted for publication to one of the conferences or workshops in the area of their project.
s2: The course features hands-on lectures and labs to analyse software vulnerabilities, both in the source code and in program binaries, and design and implement appropriate mitigation techniques.
